thread.title_full: WTA Names Steve Simon as Chief Executive - The New York Times

author: The Associated Press
title: WTA Names Steve Simon as Chief Executive
text:
Steve Simon will take over as chief executive of the Women’s Tennis Association.
 WTA Chief Stacey Allaster Decides to Leave Hectic Job Behind SEPT. 22, 2015 Since 2004, Simon has run the tournament in Indian Wells, Calif., a joint WTA and ATP event. He replaces Stacey Allaster, who said on Sept. 22 that she was stepping down .
The WTA’s board of directors acted quickly and announced Monday that it had made a unanimous decision.
The WTA released statements from several players praising Simon, including Serena Williams, who returned to Indian Wells in March after a 14-year personal boycott of the tournament.
Williams said Simon “could not have been more helpful, professional and supportive.” She called him “a good listener” who “has our best interests in mind.”
Indian Wells has become the largest two-week combined tournament in tennis outside of the Grand Slam events.
